sourceMeaningMnemonic: Your <radical>fingers</radical> have to <radical>stand</radical> up straight, to protect you from being <kanji>abduct</kanji>ed, or <kanji>pull</kanji>ed away against your will.
meaningInfo: You're convinced someone is trying to abduct you, so you need to keep your fingers standing at all times, ready to defend yourself. Your fingers are feeling pretty stiff, but you still keep them standing, just in case.
readingMnemonic: Suddenly, someone really is trying to <kanji>abduct</kanji> you. They're <kanji>pull</kanji>ling you away. It's the ancient Egyptian god <reading>Ra</reading> (<ja>ら</ja>). Help!
readingInfo: Luckily, your fingers were standing to attention and you were able to fight off the mighty Ra. He won't try to abduct you again in a hurry. Thank goodness for those standing fingers.
